article.headline: Mercer 78, Charleston Southern 59
article.story: MACON, Ga. (AP) -- James Florence scored 27 points and Mercer pulled away in the second half for a 78-59 victory over Charleston Southern on Monday night. Mercer (3-4) led 34-32 at halftime. Charleston Southern (5-4) stayed close well into the second half, and tied the score at 54-54 on a 3-pointer by Chris Moore with 9:04 to play. Sam Dolan then hit a layup to give the Bears the lead for good, and Florence followed with a 3-pointer with 8:31 to play. The margin was never less than four points after that. Moore's layup with 3:26 to play closed the gap to 68-59, but Mercer then scored the game's last 10 points. Shaddean Aaron scored 22 points for Mercer. Dwayne Jackson had 15 points and 12 rebounds for the Buccaneers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
